metadata.documentation: SPEIbase: a global 0.5º gridded SPEI data base (V2.5)
Consejo Superior de Investigaciones Científicas (IPE–CSIC), Instituto Pirenaico de Ecología, Zaragoza, Spain

Global dataset of the Standardized Precipitation-Evapotranspiration Index (SPEI) at the 34-months time scale. Using CRU TS 4.00 precipitation and potential evapotranspiration data. Dataset created in R using the SPEI package (https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/SPEI/; https://github.com/sbegueria/SPEI). Data publicly available at http://sac.csic.es/spei.
Public dataset included in the PUBLIC_DATA group of the User Data Gateway (UDG). Register and accept the data policy to access to this dataset (http://www.meteo.unican.es/udg-wiki).

The publications or studies of any kind using this dataset should cite the references: Beguería S., Vicente-Serrano S., Reig F., Latorre B. (2014) Standardized precipitation evapotranspiration index (SPEI) revisited: Parameter fitting, evapotranspiration models, tools, datasets and drought monitoring. International Journal of Climatology 34, 3001-3023.; Vicente-Serrano S.M., Beguería S., López-Moreno J.I. (2010) A Multiscalar Drought Index Sensitive to Global Warming: The Standardized Precipitation Evapotranspiration Index. Journal of Climate 23, 1696–1718.; Beguería S., Vicente-Serrano S., Angulo-Martínez M. (2010) A multi-scalar global drought data set: the SPEIbase. Bulletin of the American Meteorological Society 91(10), 1351–1356.
